issues.description: The problem statement describes PersonController methods as taking a Consumer<List<Note>> parameter (copied from NoteController) but the template (and solution) PersonController methods actually use Consumer<List<Person>>. This mismatch between documentation and code signatures can confuse students about the correct type.
issues.suggested_fix: Correct the problem statement to refer to Consumer<List<Person>> for the PersonController methods instead of Consumer<List<Note>> so that it matches the template and solution code.

issues.description: The template declares the internal collection in PersonService as a List<Person> (private final List<Person> persons) but the solution reference implementation changes this to a Set<Person>. This attribute type mismatch contradicts the problem statement note (‘Do not change the attributes of PersonService’) and can lead to confusion or test failures.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the type of the `persons` field in PersonService between template and solution. For example, revert the solution implementation to use `private final List<Person> persons` so it matches the template and honors the problem statement’s instruction.
